title: Christmas Short Works 2012
creator: Various
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox Christmas Short Works Collection, 2012. The worldwide LibriVox community brings you 26 Dutch, English, French, German and Japanese recordings of short stories, poems, non-fiction articles and even a short play - all with a Christmas theme. This collection comprises: 1. GERMAN: Advent by Rainer Maria Rilke (1875-1926) read by Elli 2. GERMAN: Berliner Weihnacht 1918 von Klabund (Alfred Henschke) (1890-1928) read by Herman Roskams 3. JAPANESE: Christmas by Hagiwara Sakutaro (1886-1942) read by ekzemplaro 4. ENGLISH: The Christmas Bride by Charles Nicholas Trivess (1845-?) read by TriciaG 5. ENGLISH: A Christmas Pudding by Charles Knight (1791-1893) read by Ruth Golding 6. ENGLISH: Eddi's Service by Rudyard Kipling (1865-1936) read by NoelBadrian 7. ENGLISH: Getting up a Pantomime by George Augustus Sala (1828–1895) read by Ruth Golding 8. ENGLISH: The Gift of the Magi by O. Henry (1862-1910) read by Daniel Vimont 9. ENGLISH: How to Celebrate Christmas Elizabeth Harrison (1849-1927) read by TriciaG 10. DUTCH: De Kerstboom by H.J. Overbeek (19th century) read by Bart de Leeuw 11. GERMAN: Knecht Ruprecht by Theodor Storm (1817–1888) read by Elli 12. JAPANESE: Kurisumasu no Okurimono by Takehisa Yumeji (1884-1934) read by ekzemplaro 13. ENGLISH: The Little Snowflake by Hannah More Kahaus (1745-1833) read by Charlotte Duckett 14. JAPANESE: Merry Christmas by Dazai Osamu (1909-1948) read by ekzemplaro 15. ENGLISH: The Night After Christmas Author unknown read by TriciaG 16. ENGLISH:The Night Before Christmas by Clement Clarke Moore (1779-1863) read by Verity Kendall 17. ENGLISH: Ruth's Christmas by by Abbie Phillips Walker (1867 – before 1951) read by Ruth Golding 18. ENGLISH: Saint Joseph by Alfred Gurney (1845-1898) read by David Lawrence 19. FRENCH: Salut de Noël from: L’hiver mondain par Georges Rodenbach (1855-1898) read by Herman Roskams 20. ENGLISH: Selections from Christmas Carollin' by Carolyn Wells (1862-1942) read by Chessie Joy 21. ENGLISH: Some say that ever 'gainst that season comes from Hamlet, Act I, Scene I, by William Shakespeare (1564–1616) read by Winston Tharp 22. FRENCH: Tombé du Ciel from Légendes de Noël, Contes historiques by G. Lenotre (1855-1935) read by Fannie 23. ENGLISH: What Makes Christmas Christmas by Grace Latimer Jones ( - ) with a full cast 24. GERMAN: Wiegengesanglein von Johann Klaj (1616-1656) 25. ENGLISH: Within and Without by James Russell Lowell ( 1819-1891) read by rookieblue 26. ENGLISH: The Worker In Sandalwood by Marjorie L. C. Pickthall (1883-1922) read by NoelBadrian For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
